intro: Grazielia serrata, commonly known as the serrated grazielia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
